intro: Willoughbya swartziana, commonly known as the swamp willow or swamp hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in wetlands and swampy areas. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, yellow flowers with prominent stamens. It is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Willoughbya swartziana is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its striking appearance and adaptability to moist environments.
